newsitem.title: LATVIA: TILDE SEES BANKS AS MAIN MICROSOFT CLIENTS.
newsitem.headline: TILDE SEES BANKS AS MAIN MICROSOFT CLIENTS.

text.p: Tilde, one of Microsoft's representatives in Latvia, said on Tuesday that it sees banks as the main clients of the new Enterprise version of its BackOffice Family.
Tilde and SWH Komerccentrs, the two Microsoft representatives in Latvia, were behind the local introduction of the new software, which was presented globally on Tuesday.
"We see banks as our biggest potential clients for this product," Tilde manager Uldis Dzenis told Reuters.
"With this software Microsoft has proven that on-line banking and real-time stock trading are possible on PCs instead of mainframes," Dzenis said.
Microsoft is competing with Sun/Netscape/Oracle, which is also on the Latvian market, Dzenis said.
The new products include Windows NT server 4.0, SQL server 6.5 and BackOffice server 4.0. They will hit the market in the third quarter of this year, Microsoft said in a statement.
"The products are suited to clients with 200 and more computers where numerous transactions are carried out simultaneously," Dzenis said.
"Sun/Oracle started earlier with a similar system applications but Microsoft was more aggressive and quicker in updating its SQL platform, which is also more user friendly," Dzenis said.
